sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含有"认为"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: consider, think, believe, count, deem, reckon, regard
means: consider ： 指经过考虑和观察后得出的结论。
think ： 普通用词，指按照自己的意见提出看法。
believe ： 通常指根据一定的证据，经思考后而认为属实。
count ： 指作出判断后而得出的看法等。
deem ： 正式用词，常用于法律、文学，强调作判断而不是思考。
reckon ： 指对人或事作全面"权衡"，把各方面意见考虑进去后得出结论。
regard ： 侧重凭外表或表面现象作判断。多强调观点。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均可表示"在思想中形成一个看法或观念"之意。
means: think ： 最普通用词，指想或思索，也指由反复思考而作出判断或得出结论等。
conceive ： 指在头脑中组织好自己的思想，在心中形成一个系统的思想或一个见解。
imagine比conceive更强调形象思维，指在头脑中形成一个清晰明确的意象。
fancy与imagine略不同，往往指的是不切实际的，属于梦幻般的想象。
realize ： 指领悟，通过生动的构思或想象从而抓住事物的本质。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"思考，判断，思索"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: think, deliberate, meditate, muse, reason, reflect, speculate
means: think ： 一般用词，指开动脑筋形成看法或得出结论的脑力活动。不着重结论是否正确，见解是否有用。
deliberate ： 指缓慢、按部就班地作仔细而认真的思考或判断。
meditate ： 语气较强，指认真地长时间集中精力进行思考。
muse ： 通常指漫无目的地猜想。
reason ： 指根据资料、证据或事实进行推断，作出结论或判断的逻辑思维活动。
reflect ： 指回想或回顾，侧重认真而冷静地反复地思考某个问题，尤指对已发生事情的思索。
speculate ： 指推论过程，隐含在证据不足的基础上作出推测或设想。

jx.jx_cn_mean: 独立思考，自己作出决定

jx.jx_en_mean: consider (an activity others regard as odd, wrong, or difficult) as straightforward or normal
jx.jx_cn_mean: 把…看得很容易；认为…算不了什么；不把…当回事

jx.jx_en_mean: recall a past event or time

lj.lj_ls: 我老回忆起在学校的日子。

entry.def: If you think that something is the case, you have the opinion that it is the case.
entry.tran: 想;认为

example.ex: I certainly think there should be a ban on tobacco advertising...
example.tran: 我确实认为应该禁止香烟广告。

example.ex: Do you think I ought to seal the boxes up?...
example.tran: 你认为我应该把这些盒子封起来吗？

entry.def: If you say that you think that something is true or will happen, you mean that you have the impression that it is true or will happen, although you are not certain of the facts.
entry.tran: 感觉;觉得

example.ex: Nora thought he was seventeen years old...
example.tran: 诺拉觉得他有 17 岁。

example.ex: Do you think she was embarrassed about it?...
example.tran: 你觉得她曾为此而难为情吗？

entry.def: If you think in a particular way, you have those general opinions or attitudes.
entry.tran: （以某种方式）考虑，思考

example.ex: You were probably brought up to think like that...
example.tran: 你可能从小就被教育那样考虑问题。

example.ex: He can keep matters under control by silencing the demonstrators and others who think like them...
example.tran: 他可以通过压制示威者和与他们观点相同的人来控制住事态。

entry.def: When you think about ideas or problems, you make a mental effort to consider them.
entry.tran: 想;考虑;思考

example.ex: She closed her eyes for a moment, trying to think...
example.tran: 她闭了一会儿眼睛，努力思考着。

example.ex: I have often thought about this problem...
example.tran: 我常考虑这个问题。

entry.def: If you think in a particular way, you consider things, solve problems, or make decisions in this way, for example because of your job or your background.
entry.tran: (以某种方式)考虑，思考

example.ex: To make the computer work at full capacity, the programmer has to think like the machine...
example.tran: 为了让计算机充分发挥作用，程序员就得像计算机一样思考。

example.ex: I meet many businessmen, and I see they think in terms of the overall picture...
example.tran: 我认识许多商人，我发觉他们考虑问题都是从全局出发的。

entry.def: If you think of something, it comes into your mind or you remember it.
entry.tran: 想到;想起;想出

example.ex: Nobody could think of anything to say...
example.tran: 谁也想不出什么话说。

example.ex: I can't think of any reason why he should do that...
example.tran: 我想不出来他为什么非要那样做。

entry.def: If you think of an idea, you make a mental effort and use your imagination and intelligence to create it or develop it.
entry.tran: 想出，想到(主意)

example.ex: He thought of another way of getting out of the marriage...
example.tran: 他又想到一个摆脱那桩婚姻的点子。

example.ex: I don't know why I never thought of that.
example.tran: 我怎么就从未想到过那一点。

entry.def: If you are thinking something at a particular moment, you have words or ideas in your mind without saying them out loud.
entry.tran: 心里想;琢磨

example.ex: She must be ill, Tatiana thought...
example.tran: 她一定是病了，塔蒂亚娜心想。

example.ex: I remember thinking how lovely he looked...
example.tran: 我记得曾经在心里暗想他的样子多么可爱。

entry.def: If you think of someone or something as having a particular quality or purpose, you regard them as having this quality or purpose.
entry.tran: 认为，以为(人或物具有某特点或用途)

example.ex: We all thought of him as a father...
example.tran: 我们都视他为父亲。

example.ex: He thinks of it as his home...
example.tran: 他将那儿当作自己的家。

entry.def: If you think a lot of someone or something, you admire them very much or think they are very good.
entry.tran: 对…评价(很高)

example.ex: To tell the truth, I don't think much of psychiatrists...
example.tran: 说实话，我不太喜欢精神科医生。

example.ex: The Director thought a good deal of him...
example.tran: 主任对他评价很高。

entry.def: If you think of someone, you show consideration for them and pay attention to their needs.
entry.tran: 关心;考虑;为…着想

example.ex: I'm only thinking of you...
example.tran: 我一心只为你着想。

example.ex: You never think of anyone but yourself...
example.tran: 你从来不考虑别人，就只顾你自己。

entry.def: If you are thinking of taking a particular course of action, you are considering it as a possible course of action.
entry.tran: 考虑;打算

example.ex: Martin was thinking of taking legal action against Zuckerman...
example.tran: 马丁在考虑对朱克曼提起诉讼。

example.ex: Have you ever thought of marrying?...
example.tran: 你有没有想过结婚？

entry.def: You can say that you are thinking of a particular aspect or subject, in order to introduce an example or explain more exactly what you are talking about.
entry.tran: (用来引出例子或进一步解释)考虑,想到(某方面、某主题)

example.ex: I'm primarily thinking of the first year...
example.tran: 我考虑的主要是第一年。

example.ex: There is a theme of tragedy that runs through it: I'm thinking in particular of the story of Tom Howard.
example.tran: 贯穿始终的是一个悲剧主题，特别是汤姆·霍华德的故事。

entry.def: You use think in questions where you are expressing your anger or shock at someone's behaviour.
entry.tran: (用于问句，表示生气、震惊)认为，以为

example.ex: Who does she think she is? Trying to make a fool of me like that...
example.tran: 她以为她是谁啊？竟敢那样取笑我。

example.ex: You can't do this! What do you think you're doing?...
example.tran: 你不能这样做！你以为自己在干些什么？

entry.def: You use think when you are commenting on something which you did or experienced in the past and which now seems surprising, foolish, or shocking to you.
entry.tran: 想来，想想看(用于评论过去所做或经历过的事情现在看来不可思议、愚蠢或令人震惊)

example.ex: To think I left you alone in a place with a madman at large!...
example.tran: 想想看，我竟然把你一个人抛在那儿，让你和一个无人看管的疯子呆在一起！

example.ex: When I think of how you've behaved and the trouble you've got into!
example.tran: 现在想想看，你都做了些什么，闯了多少祸！

entry.def: You can use think in expressions such as you would think or I would have thought when you are criticizing someone because they ought to or could be expected to do something, but have not done it.
entry.tran: 本来以为，原以为(用于批评别人该做某事而未做)

example.ex: You'd think you'd remember to wash your ears...
example.tran: 还以为你能记得洗耳朵呢。

example.ex: We would have thought he would have a more responsible attitude...
example.tran: 我们本以为他会采取更负责的态度。

entry.def: You can use think in expressions such as anyone would think and you would think to express your surprise or disapproval at the way someone is behaving.
entry.tran: 谁都会以为/你会认为(用于对他人的行为表示惊讶或不满)

example.ex: Anyone would think you were in love with the girl...
example.tran: 谁都会以为你和那个姑娘恋爱了。

example.ex: You'd think you had never seen a door before!
example.tran: 就好像你以前连门都见过一样！

entry.def: You use expressions such as come to think of it ,when you think about it, or thinking about it, when you mention something that you have suddenly remembered or realized.
entry.tran: (表示突然记起或意识到某事)想起来了，想想看

example.ex: He was her distant relative, as was everyone else on the island, come to think of it...
example.tran: 想起来了，他和岛上的其他人一样，都是她的远亲。

example.ex: When you think about it, he's probably right.
example.tran: 现在想想看，他很可能是对的。

entry.def: You use 'I think' as a way of being polite when you are explaining or suggesting to someone what you want to do, or when you are accepting or refusing an offer.
entry.tran: 我想，我觉得(用于委婉地解释等)

example.ex: I think I'll go home and have a shower...
example.tran: 我觉得我得回家冲个澡。

example.ex: We need a job, and I thought we could go around and ask if people need odd jobs done...
example.tran: 我们需要工作，我看我们可以四处打听打听，看有没有零活可做。

entry.def: You use 'I think' in conversations or speeches to make your statements and opinions sound less forceful, rude, or direct.
entry.tran: 我认为，我想(用于会话或讲话中，使语气稍显婉转)

example.ex: I think he means 'at' rather than 'to'...
example.tran: 我想，他是想说at，而不是to。

example.ex: Thanks, but I think I can handle it...
example.tran: 谢谢，不过我想我自己能应付。

entry.def: You say just think when you feel excited, fascinated, or shocked by something, and you want the person to whom you are talking to feel the same.
entry.tran: 你想一想，想象一下(表示激动、着迷或震惊，同时希望谈话对方也有同感)

example.ex: Just think; tomorrow we shall walk out of this place and leave it all behind us forever...
example.tran: 你想想看，明天我们就要走出这个地方，再也不回来了。

example.ex: Just think how snug and cosy we could be.
example.tran: 想象一下，我们可以多么温暖舒适呀。

entry.def: If you think again about an action or decision, you consider it very carefully, often with the result that you change your mind and decide to do things differently.
entry.tran: 重新考虑，再三斟酌(常指最终改变主意)

example.ex: It has forced politicians to think again about the wisdom of trying to evacuate refugees...
example.tran: 这迫使政治家们重新考虑疏散难民是否明智。

example.ex: He intends to ask the court to think again.
example.tran: 他打算请求法庭再重新审度。

entry.def: If you think nothing of doing something that other people might consider difficult, strange, or wrong, you consider it to be easy or normal, and you do it often or would be quite willing to do it.
entry.tran: 认为…没什么了不起;觉得…很容易;认为…无所谓

example.ex: I thought nothing of betting £1,000 on a horse.
example.tran: 我认为把 1,000 英镑押在一匹马身上没什么了不起。

entry.def: If something happens and you think nothing of it, you do not pay much attention to it or think of it as strange or important, although later you realize that it is.
entry.tran: 对…不在意;不觉得…奇怪(或重要)

example.ex: When she went off to see her parents for the weekend I thought nothing of it...
example.tran: 她周末去看她的父母，我当时没觉得有什么特别的。

example.ex: One of Tony's friends, David, kept coming to my house but I didn't think anything of it.
example.tran: 托尼的朋友戴维经常来我家，不过我当时并没多想。

means.word_mean: 1. an instance of deliberate thinking;

sentences.sentence: "I need to give it a good think"

means.word_mean: 1. judge or regard; look upon; judge;

sentences.sentence: "I think he is very smart"
"I believe her to be very smart"
"I think that he is her boyfriend"
"The racist conceives such people to be inferior"

means.word_mean: 2. expect, believe, or suppose;

sentences.sentence: "I imagine she earned a lot of money with her new novel"
"I thought to find her in a bad state"
"he didn't think to find her in the kitchen"
"I guess she is angry at me for standing her up"

means.word_mean: 3. use or exercise the mind or one's power of reason in order to make inferences, decisions, or arrive at a solution or judgments;

sentences.sentence: "I've been thinking all day and getting nowhere"

means.word_mean: 4. recall knowledge from memory; have a recollection;

sentences.sentence: "I can't remember saying any such thing"
"I can't think what her last name was"
"can you remember her phone number?"
"Do you remember that he once loved you?"
"call up memories"

means.word_mean: 5. imagine or visualize;

sentences.sentence: "Just think--you could be rich one day!"
"Think what a scene it must have been!"

means.word_mean: 6. focus one's attention on a certain state;

sentences.sentence: "Think big"
"think thin"

means.word_mean: 7. have in mind as a purpose;

sentences.sentence: "I mean no harm"
"I only meant to help you"
"She didn't think to harm me"
"We thought to return early that night"

means.word_mean: 8. decide by pondering, reasoning, or reflecting;

sentences.sentence: "Can you think what to do next?"

means.word_mean: 9. ponder; reflect on, or reason about;

sentences.sentence: "Think the matter through"
"Think how hard life in Russia must be these days"

means.word_mean: 10. dispose the mind in a certain way;

sentences.sentence: "Do you really think so?"

means.word_mean: 11. have or formulate in the mind;

sentences.sentence: "think good thoughts"

means.word_mean: 12. be capable of conscious thought;

sentences.sentence: "Man is the only creature that thinks"

means.word_mean: 13. bring into a given condition by mental preoccupation;

sentences.sentence: "She thought herself into a state of panic over the final exam"

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English thencan, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch and German denken

sentences.cn: 我考虑的主要是第一年。

sentences.cn: 贯穿始终的是一个悲剧主题，特别是汤姆·霍华德的故事。

sentences.cn: 她以为她是谁啊？竟敢那样取笑我。
sentences.en: Who does she think she is? Trying to make a fool of me like that...

sentences.cn: 你不能这样做！你以为自己在干些什么？
sentences.en: You can't do this! What do you think you're doing?...

sentences.cn: 想想看，我竟然把你一个人抛在那儿，让你和一个无人看管的疯子呆在一起！
sentences.en: To think I left you alone in a place with a madman at large!...

sentences.cn: 现在想想看，你都做了些什么，闯了多少祸！
sentences.en: When I think of how you've behaved and the trouble you've got into!

sentences.cn: 当顾客们常常受一系列精心设计的日常暗示的影响而不假思索地吃零食或擦拭柜台时，他们的这些习惯已经为公司赚取了数十亿美元。
sentences.en: These habits have helped companies earn billions of dollars when customers eat snacks or wipe counters almost without thinking, often in response to a carefully designed set of daily cues.

sentences.cn: 他真的去四处奔走, 一路思索着.然后, 因为天气寒冷, 走进了一家旅馆.
sentences.en: He really strolled about, thinking, and then, the weather being cold, stepped into a hotel.
sentences.from: 英汉文学 - 嘉莉妹妹

sentences.cn: 在整个飞行中, 他坐在副驾驶员的座位上,全神贯注在狠毒的思索中.
sentences.en: Plunged in dark thought, he sat in the copilot's seat throughout the journey.

sentences.cn: 我不知道被邀请者的确切人数,但不用思索,我认为会有40人左右.
sentences.en: I don't know the exact number of people who have been invited but off the top of my head I should think there will be about forty.

sentences.cn: 考虑时要从容不迫, 但是行动时刻一旦来临, 马上停止思索并立刻行动.
sentences.en: Takd time to deliberate; but when the time for action arrives, stop thinking and go in.

sentences.cn: 每一次尝试之后,他都在思索新的材料该如何发挥作用.
sentences.en: After each trial he thought about how the new substance had acted.

sentences.cn: 我在浪费时间,当我在这上面思索.
sentences.en: I'm wasting time when I think about it.

sentences.cn: 我在努力思索他的模样像谁.
sentences.en: I'm trying to think who he reminds me of.

sentences.cn: 然后他思索起山区滑湿的步道和冰冷的瀑布.
sentences.en: Then he thought about the slippery walk up the mountain and the cold , cold waterfall.

sentences.cn: 思索了好久以后, 他想出了答案.
sentences.en: After much thought, the answer came to him.

sentences.cn: 对这个问题的答案她进行了苦苦的思索.
sentences.en: She thought herself into a state of panic over the final exam.

sentences.cn: 各州领导人都在认真思索让身份不明者取得驾照带来的危险.
sentences.en: State leaders are seriously thinking about for a driver's license to obtain the unknown risks.

sentences.cn: 战争留给人们无尽的思索.
sentences.en: War leaves people unending thought.

sentences.cn: 方方通过双重悲剧表达了她对于爱情甚至生命终极的思索与追问.
sentences.en: Fang Fang expresses, by means of these, her thinking about love and life.

sentences.cn: 现在, 只要她一专心思索活着这件事,脑海中便会马上浮现死亡的念头.
sentences.en: Asas she concentrated on being alive now, the thought of dying also came into her mind.

sentences.cn: 她怀着恐怖的心情看着它, 随即不加思索地急忙握紧了手.
sentences.en: She looked at it in horror and, before she thought , she swiftly clenched her fist.

sentences.cn: 我致力思索那问题.
sentences.en: I applied thought to the question.

sentences.cn: 然后她走到摇椅边,坐下来思索.
sentences.en: Then she went back to the rocker to think.
sentences.from: 英汉文学 - 嘉莉妹妹

sentences.cn: 滑稽演员使人发笑, 同时也使人思索生活.
sentences.en: Comedians make people laugh, but also think about life.

sentences.cn: 包尔第得先生给索米斯提供了思索的食粮.
sentences.en: Mr. Polteed provided Soames with food for thought.

sentences.cn: 节目寻访拥有特殊经历的人物, 一起见证历史, 思索人生.
sentences.en: Search program has special experience of people, to witness history, thinking of life.

sentences.cn: 维尔福夫人却依旧沉浸在思索里.
sentences.en: Madame de Villefort remained immersed in thought.

sentences.cn: 当那场激烈的小战斗进行时, 我根本没有时间思索,也不知当时是不是害怕.
sentences.en: While the brush lasted, I had not the time to think if I was frightened.

sentences.cn: 他思索了片刻后,便把这事抛到脑后去了.
sentences.en: He thought for a moment and then quickly dismissed the matter from his mind.

sentences.cn: 曹先生看出他正在思索,轻轻的坐下,等着他说.
sentences.en: Mr. Cao saw that he was thinking and sat down quietly waiting for him to speak.
sentences.from: 汉英文学 - 骆驼祥子

sentences.cn: 在我身陷困境的时候, 你们会不假思索的帮助我,让我去抵挡困难.
sentences.en: When I am at stake, you will assist me to resist without think anything.

sentences.cn: 沈思就是劳动, 思索就是行动.
sentences.en: To meditate is to labor; to think is to act.

sentences.cn: 他说这句话就好像在出声地思索.
sentences.en: This was said as if thinking aloud.

sentences.cn: 他们在雨中朝家走去,有好一会儿, 那个男孩一直在思索着什么.
sentences.en: For a long time while they were walking home through the rain, the boy was thinking.

sentences.cn: 他们象孩子那样,由于眼前难以理解的事情,仍然在苦苦思索着.
sentences.en: They remained in thought, like children in the presence of the incomprehensible things.
